page.title: 16RECREATION IN TERLING
page.content: Many of the activities in the village have been mentioned in our pages on Clubs, but here are some more which are not really clubs. The Playgroup is now well attended and in term time is on every Tuesday and Thursday from 9.30.am until 12noon in the village hall. This is for children from two and a half up to school age at nearly five. The Village Hall, which was built by voluntary labour, is widely used for a number of activities including Dances, Discos, Concerts, Plays, Badminton and Meetings. The only spectator sports are Football and Cricket, whilst the other sports are for people's private recreation. Many people spend their leisure time in the summer relaxing in the attractive setting of the swimming pool.
